appendix.title: Glossary
appendix.p: Abbreviations used in this glossary: n (noun), v (verb), adj (adjective)

li.title: absolute value
li.p: n, the distance on the number line from a number to 0. For example, the absolute value of -7 is 7. This fact is expressed by the equation \abs{-7} = 7.

li.title: absolute value equation
li.p: n, an equation in which the variable occurs between the absolute value bars.

li.title: absolute value inequality
li.p: n, an inequality in which the variable occurs between the absolute value bars.

li.title: algebraic expression
li.p: n, a meaningful combination of numbers, variables, and operation symbols. Also called an expression.

li.title: algebraic fraction
li.p: n, a fraction whose numerator and denominator are polynomials. Also called a rational expression.

li.title: algebraic solution
li.p: n, a method for solving equations (or inequalities) by manipulating the equations (or inequalities). Compare with graphical solution and numerical solution.

li.title: allometric equation
li.p: n, an equation showing the (approximate) relationship between a living organism's body mass and another of the organism's properties or processes, usually given in the form y = k (\text{mass})^p.

li.title: altitude
li.p: n, (i) the distance above the ground or above sea level; (ii) the vertical distance between the base and the opposite vertex of a triangle, pyramid, or cone; (iii) the distance between parallel sides of a parallelogram, trapezoid, or rectangle. Also called height.

li.title: amortization
li.p: n, the payment of a debt through regular installments over a period of time.

li.title: amount
li.p: (in an interest-bearing account), n, the sum of the principal that was invested and all the interest earned.

li.title: amplitude
li.p: n, the vertical distance between the midline and the maximum value of a sinusoidal function.

li.title: annuity
li.p: n, sequence of equal payments or deposits made at equal time intervals.

li.title: approximation
li.p: n, an inexact result.

li.title: area
li.p: n, a measure of the two-dimensional space enclosed by a polygon or curve, typically expressed in terms of square units, such as square meters or square feet, etc.

li.title: ascending powers
li.p: n, an ordering of the terms of a polynomial so that the exponents on the variable are increasing, such as in the polynomial 1 + x + x^2.

li.title: associative law of addition
li.p: n, the property that when adding three or more terms, the grouping of terms does not affect the sum. We express this formally by saying that if a, b, and c are any numbers, then (a + b) + c = a + (b + c).

li.title: associative law of multiplication
li.p: n, the property that when multiplying three or more factors, the grouping of factors does not affect the product. We express this formally by saying that if a, b, and c are any numbers, then (a \cdot b) \cdot c = a \cdot (b \cdot c).

li.title: asymptote
li.p: n, a reference line (or curve) towards which the graph of an equation tends as the value of x and/or y grows or diminishes without bound.

li.title: augmented matrix (for a linear system with n variables in standard form),
li.p: n, the matrix obtained by making each row of the matrix correspond to an equation of the system, with the coefficients of the variables filling the first n columns, and the last (that is, the n + 1) column having the constants.

li.title: axis
li.p: n, (plural axes), a line used as a reference for position and/or orientation.

li.title: axis of symmetry
li.p: n, a line that cuts a plane figure into two parts, each a mirror image of the other.

li.title: back substitution
li.p: n, a technique for solving a triangular system of linear equations.

li.title: bar graph
li.p: n, a picture of numerical information in which the lengths or heights of bars are used to represent the values of variables.

li.title: base
li.p: n, (i) a number or algebraic expression that is used as a repeated factor, where an exponent indicates how many times the base is used as a factor. For example, when we write 3^5, the base is 3. (ii) The bottom side of a polygon. (iii) The bottom face of a solid.

li.title: base angles
li.p: n, the angles opposite the equal sides in an isosceles triangle.

li.title: binomial
li.p: n, a polynomial with exactly two terms.

li.title: binomial expression
li.p: n, a sum of two unlike terms, such as \sqrt{3}+\sqrt{2} .

li.title: build (a fraction)
li.p: v, to find an equivalent fraction by multiplying numerator and denominator by the same nonzero expression.

li.title: building factor
li.p: n, an expression by which both numerator and denominator of a given fraction are multiplied (in order to build the fraction).

li.title: cartesian coordinate system
li.p: n, the grid that associates points in the coordinate plane to ordered pairs of numbers.

li.title: cartesian plane
li.p: n, a plane with a pair of coordinate axes. Also called a coordinate plane.

li.title: change in (a variable)
li.p: n, the final value (of the variable) minus the starting value.

li.title: change of variables
li.p: n, (i) a transformation of data, (ii) substitution of a new variable for a variable expression, for example, replacing t^2 with x so that the equation y = at^2 + b becomes y = ax + b.

li.title: circle
li.p: n, the set of all points in a plane at a fixed distance (the radius) from the center.

li.title: circumference
li.p: n, the distance around a circle.

li.title: closed interval
li.p: n, a set of numbers, denoted by [a, b], which includes all the numbers between a and b as well as the numbers a and b themselves, where a and b are real numbers and a \lt b. Or the set of numbers denoted by (−\infty, b], which includes the real number b and all numbers less than b, or the set of numbers denoted by [a, \infty), which includes the real number a and all numbers greater than a.

li.title: coefficient
li.p: n, the numerical factor in a term. For example, in the expression 32a + 7b, the coefficient of a is 32 and the coefficient of b is 7.

li.title: coefficient matrix (for a linear system with n variables in standard form)
li.p: n, the matrix of n columns obtained by making each row of the matrix correspond to an equation of the system, with the coefficients of the variables filling the n columns (and the constants are not represented in the matrix).

li.title: common factor (of two or more expressions)
li.p: n, a quantity that divides evenly into each of the given expressions.

li.title: common log or common logarithm (of a given positive number x)
li.p: n, the exponent, denoted by \log x (or by \log_{10} x) for the number 10 to obtain the value x, that is, 10^{\log x} = x.

li.title: commutative law of addition
li.p: n, the property that when adding terms, the order of the terms does not affect the sum. We express this formally by saying that if a and b are any numbers, then a + b = b + a.

li.title: commutative law of multiplication
li.p: n, the property that when multiplying factors, the order of the factors does not affect the product. We express this formally by saying that if a and b are any numbers, then a\cdot b = b\cdot a.

li.title: complementary angles
li.p: n, two angles whose measures add up to 90\degree.

li.title: complete the square
li.p: v, to determine the appropriate constant to add to a binomial of the form ax^2 + bx so that the result can be written in the form a(x + k)^2.

li.title: complex conjugate (of a complex number)
li.p: n, the complex number with the same real part and opposite imaginary part; for example, the complex conjugate of 1 + i is 1 − i.

li.title: complex fraction
li.p: n, a fraction that contains one or more fractions in its numerator and/or in its denominator.

li.title: complex plane
li.p: n, a coordinate plane representing complex numbers, with the real parts corresponding to the values on the horizontal axis and imaginary parts corresponding to values on the vertical axis.

li.title: complex number
li.p: n, a number that can be written in the form a + bi, where a and b are real numbers and i^2=−1.

li.title: component
li.p: n, one of the values of an ordered pair or ordered triple.

li.title: compound inequality
li.p: n, a mathematical statement involving two order symbols. For example, the compound inequality 1\lt x\lt 2 says that "1 is less than x, and x is less than 2."

li.title: compound interest (or compounded interest)
li.p: n, an interest earning agreement in which the interest payment at a given time is computed based on the sum of the original principal and any interest money already accrued.

li.title: compounding period
li.p: n, the time interval between consecutive interest payments to an account that earns interest.

li.title: concave down (of a graph)
li.p: adj, curving so that the ends of a flexible rod would need to be bent downward (compared with a straight rod) to lie along the graph. Or equivalently, curving so that a line segment tangent to the curve will lie above the curve.

li.title: concave up (of a graph)
li.p: adj, curving so that the ends of a flexible rod would need to be bent upward (compared with a straight rod) to lie along the graph. Or equivalently, curving so that a line segment tangent to the curve will lie below the curve.

li.title: concavity
li.p: n, a description of a curve as either concave up or concave down.

li.title: concentric (of circles or spheres)
li.p: adj, having the same center.

li.title: conditional equation
li.p: n, an equation that is true for some (but not all) values of the variable(s).

li.title: cone
li.p: n, a three-dimensional object whose base is a circle and whose vertex is a point above the circle. The points on the segments joining the circle to the vertex make up the cone.

li.title: congruent
li.p: adj, having all measure(s) matching exactly. For example, two line segments are congruent when they have the same length; two triangles are congruent if all three sides and all three angles of one match exactly with the corresponding parts of the other triangle.

li.title: conjugate
li.p: n, (i) (of a complex number) the complex number with the same real part and opposite imaginary part; (ii) (of a binomial expression) the binomial expression with the same first term and opposite second term.

li.title: conjugate pair
li.p: n, (i) (of a complex number) a complex number and its conjugate; (ii) (of a binomial expression) the binomial expression and its conjugate.

li.title: consistent (of a system of equations)
li.p: adj, having at least one solution.

li.title: consistent and independent (of a system of linear equations)
li.p: adj, having exactly one solution.

li.title: constant
li.p: adj, unchanging, not variable. For example, we say that the product of two variables is constant if the product is always the same number, for any values of the variables.

li.title: constant
li.p: n, a number (as opposed to a variable).

li.title: constant of proportionality
li.p: n, the quotient of two directly proportional variables, or the product of two inversely proportional variables. Also called the constant of variation.

li.title: constant of variation
li.p: see constant of proportionality.

li.title: constraint
li.p: n, an equation or inequality involving one or more variables, typically specifying a condition that must be true in the given context.

li.title: continuous
li.p: adj, without holes or gaps. For example, a curve is continuous if it can be drawn without lifting the pencil from the page, and a function is continuous if its graph can be drawn without lifting the pencil from the page.

li.title: continuous compounding
li.p: n, an interest earning agreement in which the amount in the account is Pe^{rt}, where P is the initial principal, r is the annual interest rate, and e\approx 2.71828 is the base of the natural logarithm.

li.title: conversion factor
li.p: n, a ratio used to convert from one unit of measure to another.

li.title: coordinate
li.p: n, a number used with a number line or an axis to designate position.

li.title: coordinate axis
li.p: n, one of the two perpendicular number lines used to define the coordinates of points in the plane.

li.title: coordinate plane
li.p: n, a plane with a pair of coordinate axes. Also called the Cartesian plane or xy-plane.

li.title: corollary
li.p: n, a mathematical fact that is a consequence of a previously known fact.

li.title: costs
li.p: n, money that an individual or group must pay out. For example, the costs of a company might include payments for wages, supplies, and rent.

li.title: counting number
li.p: n, one of the numbers 1, 2, 3, 4, \ldots.

li.title: cube
li.p: n, (i) a three-dimensional box whose six faces all consist of squares; (ii) an expression raised to the power 3.

li.title: cube
li.p: v, to raise an expression to the power 3. For example, to cube 2 means to form the product of three 2s: 2^3 = 2 \times 2 \times 2 = 8.

li.title: cube root
li.p: n, a number that when raised to the power 3 gives a desired value. For example, 2 is the cube root of 8 because 2^3 = 8.

li.title: cubic
li.p: adj, having to do with the third degree of a variable or with a polynomial of degree 3.

li.title: cylinder
li.p: n, a three-dimensional figure in the shape of a soft drink can. The top and base are circles of identical size, and the line segments joining the two circles are perpendicular to the planes containing the two circles.

li.title: decay factor
li.p: n, the factor by which an initial value of a diminishing quantity is multiplied to obtain the final value.

li.title: decimal
li.p: adj, having to do with a base-10 numeration system.

li.title: decimal place
li.p: n, the position of a digit relative to the decimal point. For example, in the number 3.14159, the digit 4 is in the second decimal place, or hundredths place.

li.title: decimal point
li.p: n, the mark "." that is written between the whole number part and the fractional part of a decimal number. For example, the decimal form of 1 \frac{3}{10} is 1.3.

li.title: decreasing
li.p: adj, (i) (of numbers) moving to the left on a number line: Positive numbers are decreasing when getting closer to zero, and negative numbers are decreasing when they move farther from 0; (ii) (of a graph) having decreasing values of y when moving along the graph from left to right; (iii) (of a function) having a decreasing graph.

li.title: degree
li.p: n, a measure of angle equal to \frac{1}{360} of a complete revolution.

li.title: degree
li.p: n, (i) (of a monomial) the exponent on the variable, or if there are more than one variable, the sum of the exponents of all the variables; (ii) (of a polynomial) the largest degree of the monomials in the polynomial.

li.title: demand equation
li.p: n, an equation that gives the quantity of some product that consumers are willing to purchase in terms of the price of that product.

li.title: denominator
li.p: n, the expression below the fraction bar in a fraction.

li.title: dependent
li.p: adj, (of a system of equations) having infinitely many solutions.

li.title: dependent variable
li.p: n, a variable whose value is determined by specifying the value of the independent variable.

li.title: descending powers
li.p: n, expressed with the term with the highest degree written first, then the term with the second highest degree, etc.

li.title: diagonal
li.p: n, (i) a line segment joining one vertex of a quadrilateral to the opposite vertex; (ii) a line segment joining opposite corners of a box; (iii) the entries of a matrix whose row number match the column number, that is, the (1, 1), (2, 2), \ldots , (n, n) entries

li.title: diameter
li.p: n, (i) a line segment passing through the center of a circle (or sphere) with endpoints on the circle (sphere); (ii) the length of that line segment.

li.title: difference
li.p: n, the result of a subtraction. For example, the expression a − b represents the difference between a and b.

li.title: difference of squares
li.p: n, an expression of the form a^2 − b^2.

li.title: dimension
li.p: n, (i) (of a matrix) the numbers of rows and columns respectively of the matrix, also called the order of the matrix. For example, a matrix with dimension 2 by 3 (or 2\times 3) has two rows and three columns; (ii) a measurement defining a geometric figure, for example, the length and width are dimensions of a rectangle.

li.title: direct variation
li.p: n, a relation between two variables in which one is a constant multiple of the other (so that the ratio between the two variables is the constant), or in which one is a constant multiple of a positive exponent power of the other variable.

li.title: directed distance
li.p: n, the difference between the ending coordinate and the starting coordinate of points on a number line; the directed distance is negative if the ending value is smaller than the starting value. For example, the directed distance from 5 to 2 is 2 − 5 = −3.

li.title: directly proportional
li.p: adj, describing variables related by direct variation.

li.title: discriminant
li.p: n, (for the quadratic polynomial ax^2 + bx + c) the quantity b^2 − 4ac.

li.title: distributive law
li.p: n, the property that for any numbers a, b, and c, a(b + c) = ab + ac.

li.title: divisor
li.p: n, a quantity that is divided into another quantity. For example, in the expression a\div b, the divisor is b.

li.title: domain
li.p: n, the set of all acceptable inputs for a function or equation.

li.title: doubling time
li.p: n, (of exponential growth) the time required for a quantity to double in size.

li.title: elementary row operation
li.p: n, one of the three following operations: (1) an exchange of two rows, (2) multiplying all entries of a row by a nonzero constant, (3) adding a multiple of any row to another row.

li.title: elimination
li.p: n, a method for solving a system of equations that involves adding together the equations of the system or multiples of the equations of the system.

li.title: empirical model
li.p: n, an equation whose graph (approximately) fits a given set of data (but gives no information about the physical processes involved).

li.title: entry
li.p: n, a value in a matrix, often identified by specifying location by row and column.

li.title: equation
li.p: n, a mathematical statement that two expressions are equal, for example, 1 + 1 = 2.

li.title: equation in two variables
li.p: n, an equation that involves two variables.

li.title: equilateral
li.p: adj, (of a polygon) having all sides of equal length.

li.title: equilibrium point
li.p: n, the point where the graphs of the supply and demand equations intersect

li.title: equivalent
li.p: adj, representing the same value.

li.title: equivalent equations
li.p: n, equations that have the same solutions.

li.title: equivalent expressions
li.p: n, expressions that have the same value for all permissible values of their variables.

li.title: error tolerance
li.p: n, the allowable difference between an estimate and the actual value.

li.title: evaluate
li.p: v, to determine the value of an expression when the variable in the expression is replaced by a number.

li.title: exact
li.p: adj, not simply close, but with absolutely no deviation from an intended value.

li.title: exact solution
li.p: n, the exact value of a solution, i.e., not an approximation.

li.title: exponent
li.p: n, the expression that indicates how many times the base is used as a factor. For example, when we write 3^5, the exponent is 5, and 3^5 = 3\times 3\times 3\times 3\times 3.

li.title: exponential decay
li.p: n, a manner of decreasing characterized by a constant decay factor for any fixed specified interval of time, or equivalently, modeled by a function f with the form f(t) = ab^t, where a and b are positive constants and 0 \lt b\lt 1.

li.title: exponential equation
li.p: n, an equation containing a variable expression as an exponent.

li.title: exponential function
li.p: n, a function f which can be put in the form f(x) = ab^x, where a is a nonzero constant and b\ne 1 is a positive constant.

li.title: exponential growth
li.p: n, growth characterized by a constant growth factor for any fixed specified interval of time, or equivalently, modeled by a function f with the form f(t) = ab^t, where a and b are positive constants and b\gt 1.

li.title: exponential notation
li.p: n, a way of writing an expression that involves radicals and/or reciprocals in terms of powers that have fractional and/or negative exponents. For example, the exponential notation for \sqrt{3} is 3^{1/2}.

li.title: expression
li.p: see algebraic expression.

li.title: extraction of roots
li.p: n, a method used to solve (quadratic) equations.

li.title: extraneous solution
li.p: n, a value that is not a solution to a given equation but is a solution to an equation derived from the original.

li.title: extrapolate
li.p: v, to estimate the value of a dependent variable for a value of the independent variable that is outside the range of the data.

li.title: factor
li.p: n, an expression that divides evenly into another expression. For example, 2 is a factor of 6.

li.title: factor
li.p: v, to write as a product. For example, to factor 6 we write 6 = 2\times 3.

li.title: factored form
li.p: n, (i) (of a polynomial or algebraic expression) an expression written as a product of two or more factors, where the algebraic factors cannot be further factored; (ii) (of an equation of a parabola) the form y = a(x − r_1)(x − r_2).

li.title: feasible solution
li.p: n, an ordered pair which satisfies the constraints of a linear programming problem.

li.title: FOIL
li.p: n, an acronym for a method for computing the product of two binomials: F stands for First terms, O for Outer terms, I for Inner terms, and L stands for Last terms.

li.title: formula
li.p: n, an equation involving two or more variables.

li.title: fraction bar
li.p: n, the line segment separating the numerator and denominator of a fraction. In the fraction \frac{1}{2} , the fraction bar is the short segment between the 1 and the 2.

li.title: function
li.p: n, a relationship between two variables in which each value of the input variable determines a unique value of the output variable.

li.title: function of two variables
li.p: n, a relationship between an output variable and an ordered pair of input variables in which each ordered pair of the input variables determines a unique value of the output variable.

li.title: function value
li.p: n, an output value of a function.

li.title: fundamental principle of fractions
li.p: n, the property that the value of a fraction is unchanged when both its numerator and denominator are multiplied by the same nonzero value. We express this formally by saying if a is any number, and b and c are nonzero numbers, then \displaystyle{\frac{a\cdot c}{b\cdot c}=\frac{a}{b}} .

li.title: Gaussian reduction
li.p: n, the process of performing elementary row operations on a matrix to obtain a matrix in echelon form.

li.title: geometrically similar
li.p: adj, having the same shape (but possibly different size).

li.title: graph
li.p: n, a visual representation of the values of a variable or variables, typically drawn on a number line or on the Cartesian plane.

li.title: graph
li.p: v, to draw a graph.

li.title: graph of an equation (or inequality)
li.p: n, a picture of the solutions of an equation (or inequality) using a number line or coordinate plane.

li.title: graphical solution
li.p: n, a method for solving equations (or inequalities) by reading values off an appropriate graph. Compare with algebraic solution and numerical solution.

li.title: greatest common factor (GCF) of two or more expressions
li.p: n, the largest factor that divides evenly into each expression.

li.title: growth factor
li.p: n, the factor by which an initial value of a growing quantity is multiplied to obtain the final value.

li.title: guidepoints
li.p: n, individual points that are plotted to help draw a graph (by hand).

li.title: half-life
li.p: n, (of exponential decay) the time required for a quantity to diminish to half its original size.

li.title: half-plane
li.p: n, either of the two regions of a plane that has been divided into two regions by a straight line

li.title: height
li.p: see altitude.

li.title: hemisphere
li.p: n, half a sphere (on one side or the other of a plane passing through the center).

li.title: horizontal asymptote
li.p: n, a line parallel to the x-axis toward which the graph of an equation tends as the value of x grows or diminishes without bound.

li.title: horizontal axis
li.p: n, the horizontal coordinate axis. Often called the x-axis.

li.title: horizontal intercept
li.p: n, where the graph meets the horizontal axis. Also called x-intercept.

li.title: horizontal line test
li.p: n, a test to determine if a function has an inverse function: If no horizontal line intersects the graph of a function more than once, then the inverse is also a function.

li.title: horizontal translation (of a graph)
li.p: n, the result of moving all points of the graph straight left (or all straight right) by the same distance.

li.title: hypotenuse
li.p: n, the longest side of a right triangle. (It is always the side opposite the right angle.)

li.title: identity
li.p: n, an equation that is true for all permissible values of the variable(s).
